meanings.definition: Liked, admired, or enjoyed by many people.
meanings.sent1: The movie was very popular among my friends.
meanings.sent2: Ice cream is a popular treat during the summer.
meanings.sent3: The popular song made everyone dance at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her popular blog post went viral overnight.
meanings.sent5: The popular restaurant always has a long line of customers.

meanings.sent1: Pizza is a popular choice for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The popular color for this season is blue.
meanings.sent3: The popular vote went to the new student council president.
meanings.sent4: The popular opinion was divided on the issue.
meanings.sent5: The popular brand of shoes sold out quickly.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or representing the people, especially the common people.
meanings.sent1: The politician promised to focus on popular issues.
meanings.sent2: The popular belief was that hard work pays off.
meanings.sent3: The popular demand for the product exceeded expectations.
meanings.sent4: The popular uprising led to significant changes in the government.
meanings.sent5: The popular movement aimed to empower the community.
